Description: Body sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style pottery bowl; white slip; interior black with traces of two bands in added white at top; exterior: part of a black band at top with traces of superimposed band in added white; in frieze below, goat (front legs and hind hooves missing) with head turned back to right; at right, tip of horn of second goat (head likely also turned to right); pinwheel rosettes, blob rosettes, dashed crosses, and dashes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Probably from same piece as Britsh Museum 1965,0930.707.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.559)
